title: The difference in simple interest and compound interest on a certain sum of money at per annum for 3 years is Rs 46. What is the sum? - Quora

response.answer_text: There are two unknowns in the problem - Principle (P) and Rate (r). But we have only one equation to solve. It requires iteration and you will get different values of P and r. You need to provide rate of interest to work out a single solution of the problem. An attempt is made : CI = P * (1 +r)^3 - P = P( 1 + 3r^2 + 3r + r^3) - P = P(r^3 + 3r^2 + 3r) SI for 3 years = P * r * 3 = 3Pr The difference is 46, So, P(r^3 + 3r^2 + 3r) - 3Pr = 46 Or, P(r^3 + 3r^2 ) = 46 Or, P = 46 / ( r^3 + 3r^2) It will give innumerable values of P and r. You choose whatever suits you. For example, If r = 0.05 ( i.e.,5%), P = 6033 If, r = 0.1 ( i.e., 10%), P = 1484 etc. and so on………. You can still work out.
